isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - Meritor Transfer Cases MTC-4208, -4210, and -4213 - Power Take-Off (PTO) - Test PTO Installation

caution.para: The PTO clutch must be engaged to operate the drive. Always engage and disengage the PTO with the vehicle stationary and in Neutral. Do not apply a load to the PTO drive until the drive has been engaged. Damage to components can result.
The air pressure must not exceed 90 psi (6.2 bar). Damage to components can result.

item.para: Connect a regulated air pressure line to the air control port (Figure 66).
Apply 90 psi (6.2 bar) of air pressure.
Check for leaks in the PTO air control line.
Cycle the air control pressure. Follow the procedures below to check that the PTO clutch engages correctly.

svcsubproc.title: PTO Without an Optional Indicator Switch

step1.para: Remove the switch port screw and washer (Figure 64).
Measure the PTO push rod travel to verify that the travel is 0.75-inch (19 mm) and that the clutch is fully engaged.

item.para:
If the push rod travel is not at 0.75-inch (19 mm) and the PTO clutch is not fully engaged:
Disengage the clutch by releasing the air pressure. Rotate the clutch output shaft by hand and retest.

If the clutch still is not fully engaged: Remove the PTO assembly. Check the transfer case output shaft splines and the PTO clutch collar splines. Replace worn or damaged parts. Repeat the assembly procedures.

svcsubproc.title: PTO With an Optional Indicator Switch

step1.para: Install the indicator switch. Tighten the switch to 25-30 lb-ft (34-40.8 Nm).
Verify that the indicator switch closes when the PTO completes a shift to engage the drive (Figure 65).

item.para: If the indicator switch does not close to fully engage the drive: Perform Step 2 in the section above, PTO Without an Optional Indicator Switch.
